Package blackjack

Class Game

java.lang.Object
blackjack.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
Class that implements a blackjack game

Is responsible for creating all the objects that will in a game: both the dealer (which will have a shoe) and the player, the Statistics objects (for the player and the dealer), the GameMode object, which will get the commands according to the mode that is being played, and the Betting and Playing card counting strategies.

All the objects needed while running the program in whichever mode are created and initialized at the beginning, in the constructor of this class.

  • Field Details

    • mode

      private GameMode mode
      Object that will get the game commands according to the game mode (actual mode specified at run time).

    • minBet

      private int minBet
      Minimum value for the bet

    • maxBet

      private int maxBet
      Maximum value for the bet

    • nDecks

      private int nDecks
      Number of decks in the shoe (needed for the debug mode, where the number of decks is computed while reading the shoe file and returned by the shoe object. It will be needed later in other objects)

    • intShuffle

      private int intShuffle
      Percentage of the shoe that needs to be played before there's a shuffle

    • isReady

      private boolean isReady
      Signals if a deal ("d") command can be issued (the bet "b" was already placed)

    • startRound

      private boolean startRound
      Signals if a round is about to start (true)

    • shuffling

      private boolean shuffling
      true when the deck is to be shuffled. Defaults to true at the Game constructor for the simulation and interactive modes (shuffle at the beggining) and is always false for the debug mode

    • noHandsLeft

      private boolean noHandsLeft
      Flag so that the dealer knows if there are still any hands in play before it's turn, that is, if any of the player's hands hasn't busted or surrendered (or, in other words, if there is any hand that stands). If there aren't any hands at play before the dealers turn, he will only flip its hole card and automatically stand, since he already won to all players' hands.

    • printFlag

      private boolean printFlag
      In Simulation mode the commands and its results aren't supposed to be printed to the console

    • player

      private Player player
      Game player

    • dealer

      private Dealer dealer
      Game dealer

    • dStats

      private Stats dStats
      dealer Statistics

    • pStats

      private Stats pStats
      player Statistics (object will be created with type PlayerStats)

    • bet_strat

      private java.util.ArrayList<BettingStrategy> bet_strat
      Available betting strategies. Can be 1 or more (in the case of this version, 1 or 2, but more betting strategies could be added).

      For simplicity, the position 0 will always be the Standard betting Strategy, when available.

    • game_strat

      protected java.util.ArrayList<PlayerStrategy> game_strat
      Available playing strategies. Can be 1 or more (in the case of this version, 1 or 2, but more playing strategies could be added).

      For simplicity, the position 0 will always be the Hi-Lo playing Strategy, when available.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(char Mode_in, int minBet_in, int maxBet_in, int balance_in, int nDecks_in, int intShuffle_in, int sNumber_in, java.lang.String strategy_in)
      Constructor for the Interactive and Simulation Modes.
      Parameters:
      Mode_in - Selection of the simulation/interactive mode.
      minBet_in - Minimum value for the bet that is allowed.
      maxBet_in - Maximum value for the bet that is allowed.
      balance_in - Starting player balance.
      nDecks_in - Number of decks in the shoe.
      intShuffle_in - Percentage of the shoe that has to be played before shuffling.
      sNumber_in - Number of shuffles until the end of the simulation (when in simulation mode).
      strategy_in - Represents the strategy that will be used (when in simulation mode).

      When in interactive, both of the betting and playing strategies are applied, since when an advice (ad) command is issued, we're supposed to get information for all the available card counting strategies.

      When in simulation mode only on combination betting + playing strategy is created

    • Game

      public Game​(char Mode_in, int minBet_in, int maxBet_in, int balance_in, java.lang.String shoeFile_in, java.lang.String cmdFile_in)
      Constructor for the Debug Mode.
      Parameters:
      Mode_in - Debug mode.
      minBet_in - Minimum value for the bet that is allowed.
      maxBet_in - Maximum value for the bet that is allowed.
      balance_in - Current balance.
      shoeFile_in - File with the shoe going in the game.
      cmdFile_in - Name of the file with the commands to be issued.

      In Debug mode both betting and playing strategies are applied, since the advice command ("ad") can still be issued.

  • Method Details

    • getFullAdvice

      private java.lang.String getFullAdvice​(java.lang.String cmd)
      Receives a play command and puts it into a advice-friendly format, to be printed
      Parameters:
      cmd - advised command in short form
      Returns:
      advised command with the command name

    • shuffleState

      private void shuffleState()
      Shuffles the shoe and resets the adequate counting strategies' counters; If the game is in simulation mode, increment the counter of the number of shuffles (since this is its stopping criterion)

    • bettingState

      private boolean bettingState​(int bet)
      A bet is placed, if its value is valid, that is, if it is between min_bet and max_bet. If not, prints an error message.

      If the bet is successfully placed, sets the new bet in the used betting strategies.

      Parameters:
      bet - betting value
      Returns:
      true if betting was successful (a valid bet was issued), false otherwise.

    • printStatsState

      private void printStatsState()
      Prints the statistics information in the console, for both the player and the dealer, formated with 2 decimal places.

    • play

      public void play()
      Play State: first method called when starting a new blackjack game and at the beginning of a new round. Resets the dealer's and player's hands and checks if a shuffle is needed (if so, calls the shuffleState()). Reads a command from any source (depending on the game mode), and waits for a bet to be placed. When this happens, calls the bettingState, and if the bet is successfully placed waits for a deal ("d") command to be issued so that it calls the playRound state (unless the game is in Simulation mode, there, goes directly to the playRound state).

      Also allows commands for printing statistics, player balance, betting advice and quiting the game.

    • dealState

      private void dealState()
      The dealer deals cards to himself (firstly, and with one hole card), and then to the player. All the betting and playing strategies are updated, as well as the statistics information

    • playersTurn

      private void playersTurn()
      A player's turn: the player plays all his hands until he stands, surrenders or busts in all his hands (up to a maximum of four).

      The playing commands are obtained depending on the game mode. Throughout the player's turn, all the counts related to betting and playing strategies, as well as to the statistics, are updated.

    • dealersTurn

      private void dealersTurn()
      The dealer's turn: Starts by turning up his hole card. Hits until an hand value of at least 17 is attained, then stands; if all the player's hands have busted or surrender, then the dealer stands immediately after revealing his hole card, since he already won this round.

      For every card added (hit), game information is updated.

    • playRound

      public void playRound()
      Called by the play state when a deal command is issued, so a new round starts.

      Starts by calling the dealState, printing both the dealer and player hands (if prints are allowed). Afterwards, calls the playersTurn state. Computes if there are any player's hands still in game and then calls the dealersTurn state. Lastly, checks if there is the need to print any blackjack information and computes the round results, by calling the resultsState, updating the game information accordingly.

    • resultsState

      private void resultsState()
      For each player hand, checks the round result, updates the player's balance accordingly, prints the right information (if prints are allowed) and updates all the game information ( betting strategies counts and bet values and statistics values).

      Calls an auxiliary function that helps to determine the round's result.

    • result

      private int result​(int i)
      Calculates the results
      Parameters:
      i - player hand in which the result is being computed
      Returns:
      result: 1 - player wins, 0 - player pushes, -1 - player loses
